intro: Marlierea uaupensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. The leaves are simple, opposite, and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
